stories.text:
I'll be graduating with a Master's in control systems and looking for opportunities related to autonomous driving (motion planning & control) or robotics (mobile robots, multi-agent systems).

Background: I have prior work exp, and worked on many projects (pretty basic, not something complicated) related to these fields. I have been coding with C++ and Python for many years now, so I guess I can call myself a beginner with programming. I haven't formally worked with algorithms or algorithm design though.

Question: How can I find an opportunity in these domains, given my qualifications? Right now, I see a lot of vacancies which have insane requirements (PhD or 3+ years of relevant exp, a master-of-all skillset, etc) even for entry level positions. Is this how it always was? People who are working in robotics/AD, how did you guys do it?

PS: I live in the EU, if it helps.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to find a job in robotics/AD as a recent graduate?
